pros: Some genuinely talented and caring staff

pros: - Better balance between work and social life - students are easy to manage.
cons: Students' attendance is poor College is run on a business model rather than placing the students' best interests first.

review_title: Truly an awful place to work
pros:
High pay
Good location
Friendly teaching staff
cons:
Managers are so overworked that you hardly ever see them. 
Staff are unhappy and burnt out.
Hostile senior management
Poor safeguarding procedures

job_title: Registry Team Leader in Islington, England
pros: Low level Integral Admin and Business Support staff very knowledgeable and helpful
cons: Heads of positions too disconnected from frontline admin / business support staff and create too much pressure on Team Leaders by the Heads not having any firm understanding of their expectations over reality. Also Heads of very sneaky to implement non HR and non employment contract related hidden rules such as forcing you to only take your annual leave during half term periods

review_title: Isnt what it used to be
cons: Managers, bureaucracy, corporation, business rather than education

review_title: Good benefits but poor working environment and culture
pros:
Review based on Holloway CBAT campus ONLY

- Good holiday benefits and salary
- Good location to work
cons:
- Poor HR systems during my employment
- Poor overall senior management style which was affecting staff morale 
- Environment did not encourage independent or creative thinking
- Critical issues around diversity (ethnic mix and age) (referring to staff only)
- Whole campus needs an overhaul as it's stuck in a rut

pros: One of the better colleges to work in London, compared to some of the others.
cons: Merger has made the college unrecognisable from a few years ago. Senior management have all left and there doesn't seem to be much direction.

pros: Student focused, passion for education, well compensated with good benefits, largely collegiate, friendly and professional atmosphere with colleagues
cons: Roles can feel undefined and you can end up trying to please everyone and completing very little, lack of joined-up thinking/acting in places

pros:
Nice environment, good opportunities, good staff benefits.
The principal is very down to earth and approachable
cons: The corporate offices were quite abit groupy. Senior management never used to communicate with the support staff. that has now improved a little

pros: it was great time as disability rep. I loved working there. you have to work hard and try lots,
cons: i was voted in. it is long and hard work take up allot time
